newsitem.title: UK: Next, Kingfisher fall on Argos warning, CBI.
newsitem.headline: Next, Kingfisher fall on Argos warning, CBI.

text.p: The UK retail sector slumped on Friday -- with shares Next tumbling by more than four percent to a five-month low and Kingfisher shares shedding about 2.5 percent -- after retailer Argos issued a profit warning, dealers said. A mixed CBI report for December, showing good furniture, carpets, books, grocery sales, but weak clothing, footwear and durable sales, also weighed on the sector, they said.
By 0856 GMT, Next shares fell 24p to 527-1/2p. Shares in Kingfisher were off 18-1/2p to 623-1/2.
Shares in Argos plummeted 91p, or 12 percent, to 642.
"(Argos') trading statement and the CBI survey went a long way to hit confidence in the sector," said one.
While the CBI report showed that UK retail sales were higher in December than a year ago, sales failed to meet expectations, dealers said.

Argos, meanwhile, said sales during the second half were lower than expected and that full year pretax operating profits were unlikely to exceed 140 million stg, the lower end of current market forecasts.
